articles.content: State health officials on Saturday announced another 1,010 confirmed and presumptive COVID-19 cases as well as two more deaths, bringing the states death toll to 1,492 since the pandemic began and it… [+2353 chars]

articles.author: Ashley Talley, Kyle Morton
articles.title: New Year's Day sets record for coronavirus cases in North Carolina - WRAL.com
articles.description: North Carolina reported a record 9,527 new cases of coronavirus on New Year's Day. This was followed by another staggering total of 9,365 on January 2.
articles.content:
By Kyle Morton, WRAL.com contributor
Raleigh, N.C. — North Carolina reported a record 9,527 new cases of coronavirus on New Year's Day.

articles.author: Lindsay Tice, Sun Journal
articles.title: Maine flu cases plummet - WGME
articles.description: LEWISTON — There is one bit of good news among all the bad of the pandemic: Flu cases in Maine have dropped to a fraction of what they were a year ago. At this time last year, 919 people were confirmed to have the flu statewide. This year that number is…

articles.title: Blood vessel damage and inflammation: How COVID-19 can affect a person's brain - CTV News
articles.description: Results from a study of 19 deceased COVID-19 patients in the U.S. suggests that those who contract a SARS-CoV-2 infection may be susceptible to brain damage.

articles.title: Mexican doctor hospitalized after receiving COVID-19 vaccine - Reuters UK
